meanings.definition: A dress worn at home for casual or informal occasions.
meanings.sent1: She wore her comfortable housedresses while relaxing at home.
meanings.sent2: Many people prefer to wear housedresses rather than formal attire at home.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to climb into the oversized housedresses hanging on the laundry line.
meanings.sent4: Her collection of housedresses was a rainbow of colors, brightening up her wardrobe.
meanings.sent5: The soft fabric of the housedresses made them perfect for lounging around the house.

meanings.definition: To provide with a house dress.
meanings.sent1: She housedresses her guests with comfortable attire for a cozy evening.
meanings.sent2: The hotel aims to housedresses all its patrons with complimentary robes.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was to housedresses the audience with magically appearing outfits.
meanings.sent4: The fairy godmother waved her wand to housedresses Cinderella in a beautiful gown.
meanings.sent5: The tailor worked tirelessly to housedresses the entire cast in stunning costumes for the play.
